DOC.brief_title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Combined With Antidepressants Reduce HIV Risk Drug Relapse Among Depressed Intravenous Drug Users
DOC.detailed_description: Depression common among injection drug user ( IDUs ) ; estimate 50 % IDUs meet diagnostic criterion major depressive disorder , severe form depression . The combination drug abuse depression increase likelihood engage HIV high-risk behavior unprotected sex use unhygienic needle inject drug . Research show IDUs receive treatment depression lower rate drug relapse less likely engage high-risk sexual behavior compare IDUs receive treatment depression . Combination treatment , include cognitive behavioral therapy ( CBT ) antidepressant medication , show effective treatment depression . This study evaluate effectiveness combination treatment reduce HIV risk behavior drug relapse rate cocaine opiate addict IDUs diagnosis depression . In 9-month study , participant randomly assign either combination treatment group assessment group receive treatment . Participants assigned combination treatment receive antidepressant Celexa , attend 8 CBT session 7 psychopharmacology session . Each CBT session last 60 minute psychopharmacology session last 15 minute . If participant respond well Celexa , Wellbutrin Effexor may take instead . Participants group attend 4 study visit complete standardized psychological questionnaire interview assess depression level , drug use , high-risk sexual behavior . Blood drawn baseline Month 9 HIV testing .
